abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sub-national Governments
            Public Sector Modernization Project for Argentina were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was moderate; Bank performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory; and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            interventions should be limited to a few key institutional
            and management reforms. Without such a focus, implementation
            by the Borrower and supervision by the Bank risk losing
            sight of the operation's priorities. Modernization
            projects should be designed based on the achievement of
            specific goals and align with the Government's reform
            agenda. It is crucial to anticipate the additional
            complexities of working not only with different branches of
            government at the subnational level but also of getting
            local laws approved for project implementation. Stronger
            monitoring and evaluation processes would have allowed for
            proactive execution and mid-course adjustments, as well as
            learning from peers. Additional procurement support should
            be considered for projects that involve relatively large and
            complex procurement processes, such as the ICT investments
            within this project.
